Palimpsest

Audiowalk — Cie Nicole Seiler
  • fr
  • de
  • en

What is Palimpsest ?

Palimpsest is a choreography to listen to, a collection of sound pieces.

Palimpsest is a choreographic description of different sites.

Palimpsest is rediscovering a living and poetic past.

Palimpsest explores the poetic potential of the language of audio description. It's a series of sound pieces to be discovered in public places. Invited to go for a walk, the audience becomes the actor of the movement. They are projected onto the stage of an ephemeral theatre where the performers are absent but subtly evoked in the hyper-realistic narrative. They appear here and there in the imagination, like ghosts haunting the surrounding landscape. The set-up and writing emphasize proximity and intimacy with the listener-spectator, and endeavor to bring to life figures who are physically absent.

Palimpsest was created in 2018. Originally, the project was based on an application with geolocation that obliged users to visit the site to listen to the sound pieces. Now you can browse the website and discover the entire repertoire. Of course, you can always physically go to a location to enjoy the full experience.

How it works

Choose a location, take your smartphone and headphones and go to one of the points indicated on the map. Let yourself be guided!

Language

The pieces are written in the original language of their location.
